惹.definition: to provoke; to irritate; to vex; to stir up; to anger; to attract (troubles); to cause (problems)

惹不起.definition: can't afford to offend; dare not provoke; difficult to deal with; insufferable

惹亂子.definition: to stir up trouble; to get into trouble

惹事生非.definition: variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]

惹人.definition: to provoke (esp. annoyance, disgust etc); to offend; to attract (attention)

惹人心煩.definition: to annoy people; to be a pain in the neck

惹嘍子.definition: variant of 惹婁子|惹娄子[re3 lou2 zi5]

惹婁子.definition: to stir up trouble; to bring trouble upon oneself

惹樓子.definition: variant of 惹婁子|惹娄子[re3 lou2 zi5]

惹毛.definition: (coll.) to irritate; to annoy; to piss sb off

惹火.definition: to stir up the fire; fig. to provoke and offend people; to ruffle feathers

惹火燒身.definition: stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt; fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling

惹禍.definition: to stir up trouble; to invite disaster

惹草拈花.definition: see 拈花惹草[nian1 hua1 re3 cao3]

惹草沾花.definition: see 沾花惹草[zhan1 hua1 re3 cao3]

惹麻煩.definition: to create difficulties; to be troublesome; to invite trouble
